title: Strong earthquake strikes eastern Afghanistan, killing over 600 people
subhead: The magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the area near the Pakistani border at night on Sunday, September 1, killing at least 622 people. At least five aftershocks, including one measured at magnitude 5.2, followed it.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Malian refugee women recount repeated rapes by Russian mercenaries
subhead: Since 2021, several United Nations and International Federation for Human Rights reports have observed a rise in conflict-related sexual violence acts committed by Malian security forces and their Russian allies.
byline: By Célia Cuordifede (Hodh Ech Chargui region (Mauritania), special correspondent)

title: Alcaraz, Djokovic stroll into US Open quarter-finals
subhead: Carlos Alcaraz will face the Czech 20th seed Jiri Lehecka in the quarter-finals of the US Open, while Djokovic faces a quarter-final against fourth seed Taylor Fritz, both on Tuesday.

title: Ouahiba Bouzyane's first days in France after arriving from Morocco: 'I never dreamed of leaving my country. Things just turned out that way'
subhead: Ouahiba Bouzyane, 52, arrived from Morocco in 2002 after marrying a French man. Following a divorce and a new relationship, she is now a single mother of five in Paris.

Lorde, New Zealand electropop sensation: 'With 'Virgin,' I wanted to document my femininity'
subhead: Twelve years ago, while still a teenager, the singer rose to fame with her hit song 'Royals.' Quickly endorsed by some of the biggest names in music, the 28-year-old's unique voice and bold songwriting were a departure from music industry standards. She has just released her raw fourth album, 'Virgin,' and will perform at the Zénith in Paris on November 10.

title: Are tariffs good for the climate?
subhead: In France, half of all greenhouse gas emissions are generated by imports. Would reducing global trade through tariffs therefore improve the country's carbon footprint? The answer is not so straightforward.

title: Vanessa Paradis, a French icon
subhead: Recognized today as both a singer and an actress, the artist still appears affected by the attacks she suffered early during her fame. With the release of her eighth album 'Le Retour des beaux jours' ('The Return of Sunny Days'), Paradis agreed to an interview, but remained on her guard.
